definition: to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: The packaging and presentation you get with designer shoes gives you that whole experience.
sentences.chinese: 你买的精品鞋的包装和说明会给你一次完整经验的。

sentences.english: The WARNING heading in a manual explains dangers that might result in per sonal injury or death.
sentences.chinese: 手册中的警告标题说明会导致人员伤亡的危险。

sentences.english: The Freshman Orientation Seminar was held.
sentences.chinese: 举办学士班新生辅导说明会。

sentences.english: She had a good turnout at an initial information meeting to present the idea to small woodlot owners.
sentences.chinese: 她组织了一次构想说明会，很多小树林主都出席了。

sentences.english: Today we have scheduled three proposal presentations.
sentences.chinese: 今天我们安排了三个企划说明会。

sentences.english: This is useful for taking notes on and for illustrating points in your paper.
sentences.chinese: 这对你作业的摘要与条列说明会有帮助。

sentences.english: We need to prepare for tomorrow’s presentation.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要准备明天的介绍说明会。
